results.title: Fun in Acapulco
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Hal B Wallis and Richard Thorpe
results.brief_description: While in Acapulco, Elvis is pretty busy employed as a boat hand, lifeguard, and singer. He’s managed to capture the attention of a few of the local beauties (Ursula Andress, Elsa Cardenas), which fills in most of the spare time he has. He harbours a secret fear of heights however, after a fatal mishap during his career as a trapeze catcher leaves him shaken. Love manage to inspires him to overcome his fear of heights in the most public way possible - diving off a 136 foot cliff. Features the following songs: “Bossa Nova baby”, “You can’t say no in Acapulco”.

results.title: Fun for all
results.brief_description: Car Crazy: On an airstrip at Abbotsford, near Vancouver, young hot-rodders indulge their speed craze with the approval of policemen. Trappers at Play: The Pas, in northern Manitoba, stages the annual Trappers’ Festival. Lumberjack’s Picnic: Vancouver Island forestry champions compete and compare know-how.

results.title: Fun fancy free
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Ben Sharpsteen, Walt Disney, Jack Kinney, Bill Robert and Hamilton Luske
results.brief_description: Essentially two shorts, these charming animated child orientated tales are hosted by perennial Disney favourite Jiminey Cricket. The first, “Bongo” is a musical about an escaped circus bear searching for love and meaning in life and the second, “Mickey and the beanstalk” is based on “Jack and the beanstalk”. Features the voices of Edgar Bergen, Dinah Shore, Luana Patten, The Dinning Sisters, Clarence Nash, and Walt Disney. This was Walt Disney’s last film as the voice of Mickey.

results.title: Full time killer = Fulltime killer = Chuen jik sat sau
results.creator_credit: Milky Way Productions, Johnnie To, Andrew Lau and Ka-Fai Wai
results.brief_description: Two professional assassins engage in a battle of wits as they vie for the title of Asia’s number one hitman. Tok (Andy Lau), is an up-and-coming professional with an extravagant and flamboyant style, given to copying schemes of mass destruction from the movies and possessed of a diabolical wit. His antagonist is the Japanese-speaking O (Takashi Sorimachi), a discrete and efficient hitman who single-mindedly carries out his lethal tasks then fades into obscurity. The two men are preoccupied with the same woman, Chin (Kelly Lin), who, while Chinese, speaks fluent Japanese and runs a video store that rents films from Japan. Through a series of bloody encounters that take place across Asia, the assassins find themselves both allies and enemies, their rivalry culminating in fateful showdown. With ‘Fulltime Killer’ Johnnie To, a specialist of action cinema whose heterogeneous work oscillates between the grotesque (The Heroic Trio) and the minimalist (The Mission), has co-directed a crazed, exciting homage to the ‘bullet ballet’ sub-genre, laden with self-reflexive references and illogical narrative leaps. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Full metal jacket
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Stanley Kubrick
results.brief_description: Stanley Kubrick’s disturbing and darkly funny Vietnam war drama about the dehumanizing process involved in turning young men into trained killers is divided into two distinct acts. Based on Gustav Hasford’s “The Short-Timers”, the first part focuses on the slow descent into madness of a young recruit in basic training, Private Gomer Pyle (Vincent D’Onofrio). He undergoes a process of systematic torture, verbal abuse and cruel disciplinary measures administered by a sadistic drill Sergeant (Lee Emery). The second part shows the bastardization process in action as it follows Private Joker (Mathew Modine) as he navigates himself around the madness and senselessness of the Vietnam war. This isn’t the first time Kubrick has dealt with the inhumanities of war, having tackled similar themes in the brilliant ‘Paths of Glory’. With ‘Full Metal Jacket’ however, he achieves in presenting an absurd and chilling vision of hell on earth. Cast also includes Adam Baldwin, Arliss Howard, Dorian Harewood and Kevyn Major Hasford. Original music by Abigail Mead (Kubrick’s daughter Vivian Kubrick).

results.title: Full fathom five
results.brief_description: A study of marine life, taken from the best footage of four outstanding underwater photographers. There is no narrative, instead the film is accompanied by electronic rock music.

results.title: Full circle: the work of Doris Chase
results.creator_credit: Perspective Films, Elizabeth Wood and Doris Chase
results.brief_description: Documentary on painter, sculptor and filmmaker, Doris Chase. Ms Chase explains her work including the development of her sculptural furnishings for modern dance groups into video film works.

results.title: Full Circle (Oil)
results.creator_credit: W.M. Larkins Studio and Peter Sachs
results.brief_description: Shows the improved services and other benefits that oil brings to the backward territories. The financial and technical resources of foreign lands have tapped the liquid wealth hidden below the surface of the earth. In return a new prosperity and improved standard of living is being brought to the peoples of those formerly barren lands.

results.title: Full alert
results.creator_credit: Young Filmmakers, Brilliant Idea Group, Li Kuo-Hsing and Ringo Lam
results.brief_description: After the failure of his first Hollywood film, ‘Maximum Risk’, Lam returned to Hong Kong to shoot this $13 million action film. A claustrophobic police thriller set just after the handover of Hong Kong to China, ‘Full Alert’ revives the ‘film bleu’ tradition of Hong Kong cop and gangster films, its belligerent energy recalling the sense of anarchy in Hong Kong films of the eighties. Inspector Pao is a grizzled, jaded veteran cop who has seen it all in his years with the Hong Kong police. After a vicious murderer escapes to Taiwan, Pau vows to track him down. To him he represents a new kind of criminal— smart, canny, ambitious and vicious— a man who will stop at nothing to get what he wants. As in Michael Mann’s ‘Heat’ (1996) to which ‘Full Alert’ has been compared, the cop and the robber are set up as a pair of compelling twins/opposites driven to battle each other. They increasingly come to resemble each other in motive and character as the film progresses. Cast includes Lau Ching-Wan and Francis Ng. In Cantonese with English and Mandarin subtitles.

results.title: Full ahead Rhine
results.brief_description: Follows the journey of three of the thousands of barges which ply regularly up and down the Rhine and its tributaries. Describes some of the main towns, Dusseldorf, Cologne, Stuttgart Ludwighaven, and the industries of the areas surrounding the waterways, including coal mining, iron, steel, chemical, and primary industries.
